metadata.Description: A whole-of-society approach refers to a collaborative and inclusive approach that involves all sectors of society, including government, civil society, private sector, and individuals, in addressing complex challenges and achieving sustainable development goals.

level 1.Description: The whole-of-society approach implements the Energy Transition Strategy to ensure the active participation of all stakeholders in achieving sustainable energy goals.
The whole-of-society approach provides funding for various renewable energy projects to accelerate the transition to clean energy sources.
The whole-of-society approach focuses on community engagement to ensure the active involvement and empowerment of local communities in sustainable energy initiatives.
The whole-of-society approach is embedded in the Energy Policy to ensure the integration of diverse perspectives and expertise in decision-making processes.
The whole-of-society approach partners with non-governmental organizations to leverage their expertise and resources in implementing sustainable energy projects.
The whole-of-society approach contributes to the achievement of Sustainable Development Goals by promoting inclusive and equitable access to sustainable energy for all.
The whole-of-society approach monitors energy consumption patterns to identify areas for improvement and optimize energy efficiency measures.
The whole-of-society approach targets the reduction of energy poverty by implementing targeted interventions and programs to improve access to affordable and reliable energy services.

level 2.Subject: just energy transition
level 2.Description: The just energy transition employs a renewable energy workforce to support the transition to clean energy sources.

level 2.Subject: just energy transition
level 2.Description: The just energy transition collaborates with local communities to ensure a fair and inclusive transition to sustainable energy.

level 2.Subject: renewable energy agencies
level 2.Description: Renewable energy agencies employ experts in the field of renewable energy to drive innovation and promote the adoption of clean energy technologies.

level 2.Subject: renewable energy agencies
level 2.Description: Renewable energy agencies collaborate with research institutions to advance scientific knowledge and develop new technologies for renewable energy generation.

level 2.Subject: energy diplomacy
level 2.Description: Energy diplomacy implements Energy Efficiency Policy to promote sustainable energy practices globally.

level 2.Subject: energy diplomacy
level 2.Description: energy diplomacy focuses on improving energy access in underserved communities to promote sustainable development.

level 2.Subject: energy poverty indices
level 2.Description: Energy poverty indices implement energy access programs to provide affordable and reliable energy services to underserved communities.

level 2.Subject: energy poverty indices
level 2.Description: Energy poverty indices fund renewable energy projects to increase access to clean and sustainable energy sources.

level 3.Subject: renewable energy certificates
level 3.Description: Renewable energy certificates are implemented by the Energy Efficiency Policy to promote the use of renewable energy sources.

level 3.Subject: just energy transition
level 3.Description: The just energy transition employs a renewable energy workforce to support the transition to clean energy sources.

level 3.Subject: energy justice
level 3.Description: Energy justice initiatives aim to address energy poverty by ensuring access to affordable and reliable energy services for all.

level 3.Subject: renewable energy agencies
level 3.Description: Renewable energy agencies employ experts in the field of renewable energy to drive innovation and promote the adoption of clean energy technologies.
